title: How to Make Sticky Toffee Pudding

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 350ºF, 180ºC, or on gas mark 4.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/2\/2e\/Stickytoffee2.png","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/2\/2e\/Stickytoffee2.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":397,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":656.6666666666666,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
Details: http:\/\/www.videojug.com\/film\/how-to-make-sticky-toffee-pudding<\/a>
\n<\/p><\/div>"}Heat a pan on medium heat with the dates, water, and baking soda.
steps.description:
{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/b\/b2\/Stickytoffee3.png","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/b\/b2\/Stickytoffee3.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":433,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":715.0909090909091,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
Details: http:\/\/www.videojug.com\/film\/how-to-make-sticky-toffee-pudding<\/a>
\n<\/p><\/div>"}Cook and simmer for 4 to 5 minutes and stir occasionally to stop the liquid from overflowing.

steps.headline:
{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/5\/54\/Stickytoffee4.png","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/5\/54\/Stickytoffee4.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":443,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":732.4886877828054,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
Details: http:\/\/www.videojug.com\/film\/how-to-make-sticky-toffee-pudding<\/a>
\n<\/p><\/div>"}Blend the butter and sugar in the mixer at a slow pace.
steps.description: Turn the speed pace up to create a good consistent whip. Add one egg to the mixture and whip it in. Stop the mixer and fold in the sides of the bowl. Add the other egg into the mixture and try to get a whipped and creamy consistency.

steps.headline: Add the dates mixture and rum to the mixer.
steps.description: Add a little flour at a time and turn up the speed for a creamier mixture. Be sure it is well mixed and not lumpy.

steps.headline: Scrape the mixture into the loaf tin.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/b\/bb\/Stickytoffee7.png","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/b\/bb\/Stickytoffee7.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":291,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":481.447963800905,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
Details: http:\/\/www.videojug.com\/film\/how-to-make-sticky-toffee-pudding<\/a>
\n<\/p><\/div>"}Put the loaf tin in the preheated oven.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/0\/0d\/Stickytoffee8.png","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/0\/0d\/Stickytoffee8.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":447,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":739.2727272727273,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
Details: http:\/\/www.videojug.com\/film\/how-to-make-sticky-toffee-pudding<\/a>
\n<\/p><\/div>"}Make the toffee sauce while you wait for the pudding to be done.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/4\/4d\/Stickytoffee9.png","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/4\/4d\/Stickytoffee9.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":311,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":513.5135135135135,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
Details: http:\/\/www.videojug.com\/film\/how-to-make-sticky-toffee-pudding<\/a>
\n<\/p><\/div>"}Prick a toothpick in the pudding after it's done baking.
steps.description: If the toothpick comes out clean and dry, then it's done. If it's wet or crumbs come out with it, then the pudding may need more time in the oven.

steps.headline:
{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/c\/ca\/Stickytoffee10.png","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/c\/ca\/Stickytoffee10.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":374,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":617.292576419214,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
Details: http:\/\/www.videojug.com\/film\/how-to-make-sticky-toffee-pudding<\/a>
\n<\/p><\/div>"}Remove the pudding from the loaf tin with care.
steps.description: Tip upside down over a chopping board and

steps.headline:
{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/9\/99\/Stickytoffee11.png","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/9\/99\/Stickytoffee11.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":399,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":659.8181818181819,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
Details: http:\/\/www.videojug.com\/film\/how-to-make-sticky-toffee-pudding<\/a>
\n<\/p><\/div>"}Cut individual slices.
steps.description:
Cut into generous, chunky slices. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/5\/54\/Stickytoffee12.png\/460px-Stickytoffee12.png","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/5\/54\/Stickytoffee12.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":213,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":352.6126126126126,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
Details: http:\/\/www.videojug.com\/film\/how-to-make-sticky-toffee-pudding<\/a>
\n<\/p><\/div>"}For a neater presentation, cut the slices into two pieces.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description:
Place the individual slices on the serving plate. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/e\/e4\/Stickytoffee14.png","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/e\/e4\/Stickytoffee14.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":297,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":490.54545454545456,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
Details: http:\/\/www.videojug.com\/film\/how-to-make-sticky-toffee-pudding<\/a>
\n<\/p><\/div>"}Drizzle toffee sauce on top of the pudding. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/b\/b7\/Stickytoffee15.png","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/b\/b7\/Stickytoffee15.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":327,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":539.9095022624434,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
Details: http:\/\/www.videojug.com\/film\/how-to-make-sticky-toffee-pudding<\/a>
\n<\/p><\/div>"}Sprinkle chopped hazelnuts over the top. This is optional. A sprig of mint and a dollop of cream also make ideal toppings.

text:
Preheat the oven to 350ºF, 180ºC, or on gas mark 4. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/2/2e/Stickytoffee2.png","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/2/2e/Stickytoffee2.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":397,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":656.6666666666666,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons
Details: http://www.videojug.com/film/how-to-make-sticky-toffee-pudding

"}Heat a pan on medium heat with the dates, water, and baking soda. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/b/b2/Stickytoffee3.png","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/b/b2/Stickytoffee3.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":433,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":715.0909090909091,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons
Details: http://www.videojug.com/film/how-to-make-sticky-toffee-pudding

"}Cook and simmer for 4 to 5 minutes and stir occasionally to stop the liquid from overflowing. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/5/54/Stickytoffee4.png","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/5/54/Stickytoffee4.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":443,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":732.4886877828054,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons
Details: http://www.videojug.com/film/how-to-make-sticky-toffee-pudding

"}Blend the butter and sugar in the mixer at a slow pace. Turn the speed pace up to create a good consistent whip. Add one egg to the mixture and whip it in. Stop the mixer and fold in the sides of the bowl. Add the other egg into the mixture and try to get a whipped and creamy consistency. Add the dates mixture and rum to the mixer. Add a little flour at a time and turn up the speed for a creamier mixture. Be sure it is well mixed and not lumpy. Scrape the mixture into the loaf tin. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/b/bb/Stickytoffee7.png","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/b/bb/Stickytoffee7.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":291,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":481.447963800905,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons
Details: http://www.videojug.com/film/how-to-make-sticky-toffee-pudding

"}Put the loaf tin in the preheated oven. Bake for 40 to 45 minutes. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/0/0d/Stickytoffee8.png","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/0/0d/Stickytoffee8.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":447,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":739.2727272727273,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons
Details: http://www.videojug.com/film/how-to-make-sticky-toffee-pudding

"}Make the toffee sauce while you wait for the pudding to be done. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/4/4d/Stickytoffee9.png","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/4/4d/Stickytoffee9.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":311,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":513.5135135135135,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons
Details: http://www.videojug.com/film/how-to-make-sticky-toffee-pudding

"}Prick a toothpick in the pudding after it's done baking. If the toothpick comes out clean and dry, then it's done. If it's wet or crumbs come out with it, then the pudding may need more time in the oven. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/c/ca/Stickytoffee10.png","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/c/ca/Stickytoffee10.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":374,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":617.292576419214,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons
Details: http://www.videojug.com/film/how-to-make-sticky-toffee-pudding

"}Remove the pudding from the loaf tin with care. Tip upside down over a chopping board and {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/9/99/Stickytoffee11.png","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/9/99/Stickytoffee11.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":399,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":659.8181818181819,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons
Details: http://www.videojug.com/film/how-to-make-sticky-toffee-pudding

"}Cut individual slices. Cut into generous, chunky slices. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/54/Stickytoffee12.png/460px-Stickytoffee12.png","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/5/54/Stickytoffee12.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":213,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":352.6126126126126,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons
Details: http://www.videojug.com/film/how-to-make-sticky-toffee-pudding

"}For a neater presentation, cut the slices into two pieces. Serve. Place the individual slices on the serving plate. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/e/e4/Stickytoffee14.png","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/e/e4/Stickytoffee14.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":297,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":490.54545454545456,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons
Details: http://www.videojug.com/film/how-to-make-sticky-toffee-pudding

"}Drizzle toffee sauce on top of the pudding. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/b/b7/Stickytoffee15.png","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/b/b7/Stickytoffee15.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":327,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":539.9095022624434,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons
Details: http://www.videojug.com/film/how-to-make-sticky-toffee-pudding

"}Sprinkle chopped hazelnuts over the top. This is optional. A sprig of mint and a dollop of cream also make ideal toppings. Enjoy.
